title: R45126
content: The ACCESS Act was enacted as part of the Bipartisan Budget Act of 2018 to address various issues before Congress, including extending temporary appropriations. It was added to H.R. 1892 and passed by the House and Senate before being enacted. The Bipartisan Budget Act of 2018, enacted as H.R. 1892, included temporary continuing appropriations, supplemental appropriations, debt limit increase, spending limit increases for FY2018 and FY2019, tax provisions, and changes to mandatory spending programs. The Congressional Budget Office estimated a net savings of $3.8 billion over FY2018 through FY2027. Specific topics addressed in the report include Medicare, State Children's Health Insurance Program (CHIP), and Public Health. Division E of the Bipartisan Budget Act of 2018, titled Advancing Chronic Care, Extenders, and Social Services (ACCESS) Act, consists of twelve titles covering various provisions such as ACA, CHIP, public health extenders, children and family services, foster care, social impact partnerships program, and Medicaid. The report provides brief descriptions of each provision along with contact information for CRS analysts. Additional reports analyzing subsets of these provisions in greater detail will be linked to this report as they become available. The curr_chunk provides a list of abbreviations related to healthcare legislation and organizations, including ACA, ACO, CBO, CHIP, CMS, EHR, and more. IPAB, LVH, MA, MACRA, MDH, MedPAC, MIECHV, MSSP, NQF, PREP, PSSF, QRTP, SIP, SHIP, SNP, SSA, SSI, VBID - abbreviations related to healthcare legislation and programs.
